projects.title: Deriving Maxwell's Equations
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Deriving all 4 equations using Multivariable theorems.

Semester 1 final project

projects.title: Matrix Decomposition Proofs
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Proofs for LU, QR, Spectral, and Polar decomposition.

Semester 2 final project

projects.title: Matrix Chain Multiplication
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Presentation on how to optimize the order of matrix operations, with a computer simulation.

Final project for Linear Algebra.

projects.title: UP055 Thermo Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes for the Thermo portion of Light & Heat [UP055] at OHS.

Covers the basics of entropy and heat engines.

projects.title: UP055 Optics Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes for the Optics portion of Light & Heat [UP055] at OHS.

Covers Maxwell's equations to basic interference & diffraction.

projects.title: UP070 Relativity Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes for the Relativity portion of Modern Physics [UP070] at OHS.

Covers basic kinematical effects of special relativty to relativistic dynamics.

projects.title: UP070 Quantum Mech Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes for the Quantum Mechanics portion of Modern Physics [UP070] at OHS.

Covers the core mathematical formalism to a bit of the Schrodinger Equation.

projects.title: Particle Physics Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes on David J. Griffiths' "Introduction to Elementary Particles," read over summer.

Had a hard time keeping up. At least I learned some new words, if nothing else.

projects.title: Quantum Computation Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes on Nielsen & Chuang's "Quantum Computation and Quantum Information," read over summer.

Largely a skim.

projects.title: UP135 Quantum Comp. Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Notes for the Introduction to Quantum Computing [UP135] at OHS.

I've moved to LaTeX-based notes, which are easier to make and edit.

projects.title: Quantum OPD Calculations
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Extension of Eisert's 1999 quantum Prisoner's Dilemma to the 3x3 Optional Prisoner's Dilemma.

Semester 1 project for UP135.

projects.title: General Relativity Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description: Notes on Sean M. Carroll's "Spacetime and Geometry." Work in progress.

projects.title: Classical Mechanics Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description: Notes on V. I. Arnold's "Mathematical Methods of Classical Mechanics." Work in progress.

projects.title: Amores 1.4.1-24
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Entry for the 2024 Omnibus Sam Hood Translation Prize. First time translating without help.

Slightly saucy, as Ovid does.

projects.title: Metamorphoses VIII.183-235
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description: Literal translation attempt. Ovid's version of the story of Daedalus and Icarus.

projects.title: Metamorphoses X.243-297
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Literal translation for the story of Pygmalion and Galatea.

Mostly chosen because the themes felt similar to the Icarus story. Maybe I should've gone with a less risqu√© option.

projects.title: Alpha to Omega Notes
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
My handwritten notes on Prof. Groton's From Alpha to Omega: A Beginning Course in Classical Greek.

Greek is hard.

projects.title: Metamorphoses VIII.616-724
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Literal translation for the story of Baucis and Philemon.

Only up to line 696 because I'm busy with school.

projects.title: Hackberry: Chess Engine
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
A working chess engine in Java I made after my AP Computer Science A course.

Pretty slow, but it can avoid checkmate and capture sensibly.

projects.title: Learning WebGL
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Collection of small programs made to get familiar with WebGL.

This magnificient hellscape you see here was my result.

projects.title: Lost [Game]
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
Started out as a JS platformer.

I've since stopped working on it, but the title screen is quite nice.

projects.title: Connect-4 Tournament
projects.author: Gene Yang
projects.description:
A Connect-4 assignment and tournament I developed for the OCS20 course at OHS.

It took way longer than it should have, but an initial version is done now.
